title: Put into Low Priority Queue because of BSODs
body:
Hello Riot,

I'm not sure where to post this, so I thought I'd do it here. As of late, I've been hit with a lot of blue screens while in the middle of games, and as a result have been put into low priority queue due to "leaving too many games" when it was completely unintentional. I am not a fan of leaving games at all as I know it ruins the game for everyone. Because of this, I'm wondering if anyone who knows a thing or two about programs and software can help me identify what's causing my Blue screens.

A little background, I also play on Garena, where this particular problem had first started. I'd be in the middle of any game, even a Ranked game, and I'd be hit with a "Driver IRLQ not Less or Equal - L1C63x64.sys" BSOD. Initially, I thought it was a Garena-related issue and left it at that, making sure to rejoin the game afterwards, but majority of the time, we would've lost any sort of advantage and would either be breaking even or even losing by the time I'd got back in. This is the first time I've had it happen while playing on the OCE server, and I'm starting to feel concerned as I don't want to get permanently banned because of something I could've prevented.

My initial diagnosis was that it could've been due to one of my VPN programs, Pulse Secure, that I use when I go to Uni for classes, so in between games I'd try to ensure that the program wasn't running as it had a habit of starting up in the background. I was under the impression that it might be somehow interfering with my internet connection, and so I'd ensure that Pulse was always off or I'd open task manager and end task manually. Fast forward 5 months, and a BSOD hit last night even when Pulse was off. Because of this, I'm starting to think it may be because of Discord. I've noticed that a lot of my BSODs have occurred when I'm in Voice Chat with my friend while we're playing together. Last night, when I was in game, I hadn't been in voice chat but I do know that Discord was open in the background.

I was wondering if I could have some help shedding light on this issue, and helping me check error logs, if there's anything of the sort that can be looked at to identify the problem and eliminate it permanently.

Thank you in advance, I'd appreciate any help.

replies.body: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAND it happened again. What do I even do now, I don't even know.
Alright, I've done it and nothing has happened so far. Hopefully it stays that way.

How old is the Laptop/PC you play on?

Either way, the quote you gave, google it, you should be able to find topics about it, as most error's someone else has experienced before.

Potential fix article:

https://neosmart.net/wiki/irql-not-less-or-equal/#Cause_5A_downgraded_Windows_installation
